messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name:  I will derive this data from the following paragraph: INCIDENT REPORT: #Z-7890-NW DATE: 01/05/25  On the early morning of January 5, a significant fire broke out at Pine Woods Apartment Complex, causing extensive damage to two buildings. Initial evaluations suggest that the fire might have been the result of faulty wiring. There were 15 reported injuries, with no casualties.  LAW ENFORCEMENT RESPONSE:  FIRST RESPONDENTS: Patrol Officer A. B. C. Rodriguez and Patrol Officer D. E. F. Hughes quickly responded to the scene, assisting in the evacuation of residents and securing the immediate area. FIRE COORDINATION: Sergeant G. H. I. Simmons worked closely with the Fire Department, ensuring a coordinated response and making sure fire lanes remained clear. INVESTIGATION TEAM: Detectives J. K. L. Moreno and M. N. O. Price were assigned to investigate the cause of the fire and to gather statements from residents and witnesses. FORENSIC UNIT: Technician P. Q. R. O'Sullivan and Criminalist S. T. U. D'Souza were on-site to inspect the fire's origin and gather any related evidence. Dr. V. W. X. Blake was present to treat and assess the injuries of the affected residents. Officer Rodriguez played a crucial role in safely evacuating a family trapped on the third floor, while Officer Hughes helped control the gathering crowd and directed them to safety zones. Sgt. Simmons' coordination efforts were pivotal in ensuring an effective and fast response from emergency services. Detectives Moreno and Price collected testimonies indicating possible electrical issues in the building. The forensic unit, aided by O'Sullivan and D'Souza, pinpointed the fire's starting point, and Dr. Blake confirmed smoke inhalation as the primary cause of injury for most victims.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: Patrol Officer A. B. C. Rodriguez  
Officer Context: Officer Rodriguez assisted in evacuating a trapped family on the third floor.  
Officer Role: Patrol Officer 

Officer Name: Patrol Officer D. E. F. Hughes  
Officer Context: Officer Hughes managed the crowd and directed them to safety zones.  
Officer Role: Patrol Officer 

Officer Name: Sergeant G. H. I. Simmons  
Officer Context: Sgt. Simmons coordinated the response with the Fire Department.  
Officer Role: Sergeant 

Officer Name: Detective J. K. L. Moreno  
Officer Context: Detective Moreno collected statements indicating electrical issues.  
Officer Role: Detective 

Officer Name: Detective M. N. O. Price  
Officer Context: Detective Price was involved in the fire's investigation.  
Officer Role: Detective 

Officer Name: Technician P. Q. R. O'Sullivan  
Officer Context: Technician O'Sullivan inspected the fire's origin.  
Officer Role: Technician 

Officer Name: Criminalist S. T. U. D'Souza  
Officer Context: Criminalist D'Souza gathered evidence related to the fire.  
Officer Role: Criminalist 

Officer Name: Dr. V. W. X. Blake  
Officer Context: Dr. Blake assessed the injuries and treated affected residents.  
Officer Role: Medical Officer
